ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates how to add multiple axis markers on composite renderable series
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates how to add multiple axis markers for the [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#SeriesValueModifier.html']SeriesValueModifier[/url] on composite renderable series.
By default, SeriesValueModifier shows multiple axis markers for the following composite series: - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Band%20Series%20Type.html']Band Series[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Digital%20Band%20Series%20Type.html']Digital Band Series[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Grouped%20Column%20Series%20Type.html']Grouped Column Series[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Stacked%20Columns%20Type.html']Stacked Column Series[/url] - [url='https://www.scichart.com/documentation/win/current/webframe.html#The%20Stacked%20Mountains%20Type.html']Stacked Mountain Series[/url]
If you need to create additional SeriesValue markers, you can inherit the default SeriesInfo provider and override the OnAppendDataColumnInfo method.
[b][i]Example Usage[/i][/b]
Click the START button to start the example. Now you can zoom and pan the chart, it continues to tick and update in real-time.
